channel.title: Evolution Or Creation?
channel.description:
I am curious to see what people will say to this.
I believe that god created the earth using evolution.
Kind of a mix of the both.
I know it sounds kind of weird but that is wat i believe so... Fuc da haterrrzz pl0x
Also please don't flame people because of what they believe in.
I do not want this to turn into onje huge argument.
I jsut want to know what people think.

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Creationism is a result of emotion, politics and ignorance. Not science.

Evolution has so much evidence supporting it that it is now almost considered an axiom, akin to all matter being made from atoms.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

There are extremists in every group, though. I’d be interested to know, for example, if MITB believes an ark with 2.5 million animals was bumbling around.

The technology required to build such a huge ship would be too futuristic for one guy and his family. 2.5 million animals, the size of the animals would average around the size of a human. It is impossible to build a ship for 2.5 million humans from wood. Steel isn’t up to that task either. Modern cruise ships can carry up to 20.000 people if you fill the casino’s etc. And that’s a really really rough estimate. So you need space for 2.5 million animals and space for various kinds of food. Average animals eat about 2 kg a day, so that’s 5 million kg of food per day and 2.5 million * 80kg for average animals. Let’s say this flood came and went (where did the water go?) in 10 days. That requires a ship capable of keeping 250 million kg afloat. I don’t know what the buoyancy of the wood used is, but let’s say 1 kg of wood can keep itself and 1 kg extra floating (this kind of wood doesn’t exist, the max is about 830kg extra per 1000kg of wood). That requires 125 million kg of wood. I don’t know what wood was popular those days, but let’s say the average density of wood was 600 kg/cu.m This requires 208333 cubic metres of wood!

Some might say that Noah was helped by god, but if a god is powerful enough to construct an impossible ship he might aswel just make everyone vanish and start all over again.

Not to mention the fact that every animal including humans would be retarded and malformed now. Oh wait, of course, god can prevent that. But he can’t prevent crime and blasphemy?

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

There are extremists in every group, though. I’d be interested to know, for example, if MITB believes an ark with 2.5 million animals was bumbling around.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Mopman:

I just assumed that with stories as sensational (and stupid) as the old testament, people were using them as allegories. Are you telling me, for example, that otherwise intelligent people believe a bush spontaneously combusted and then spoke to a man? Or that a dude sailed around in an ark with (roughly) 2.5 million animals on it?

Yes, some do, I’ve spoken to them.

They believe all the common-sense stuff about modern medicine, science and all that stuff. But also believe things like water-into-wine, walking-on-water, resurrection and virgin birth.
Its really wierd.

Without meaning to labour the point, they literally believe that stuff. I asked this guy if he believed that Jesus literally made water molecules change into the mixture of ethanol and acids that make up wine and he said yes!

I suspect they practise doublethink, as described in Nineteen Eighty Four by George Orwell.

There are people who travel around the Red Sea looking for the possible spot where it was parted. People believed the Turin Shroud was the cloth Jesus’s body was wrapped up in. There are people who try to study so-called Flood Geology, where all of geology is interpreted in terms of Noah’s flood.

Theres some people who take their beliefs very seriously, in a way that would probably seem strange to many of us.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Plenty of the bible says “take me metaphorically” actually, although admittedly only in the new testament.

I just assumed that with stories as sensational (and stupid) as the old testament, people were using them as allegories. Are you telling me, for example, that otherwise intelligent people believe a bush spontaneously combusted and then spoke to a man? Or that a dude sailed around in an ark with (roughly) 2.5 million animals on it?

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Mopman:

Attacking christianity by treating obvious metaphorical stories as if they were literal is a bit much

There are some sects who say its literal, some say metaphorical. Which interpretation is correct? All those sects assert that they alone are correct and that other sects are wrong.
Theres nothing in the bible which says “take this part literally, take this part metaphorically”.

I’m not convinced that you’re meant to take that part metaphorically.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

Attacking christianity by treating obvious metaphorical stories as if they were literal is a bit much

The majority of the Christians base their life on the bible. If the first stories are false, why would you still believe the rest? If you life by the laws of your country, and you find out that the constitution allows the government to enslave you (just an example), you’ll start to doubt the honesty of the other laws too, won’t you?

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

R.I.P RSC, you’re talking about a god-of-gaps argument, I think you should google that for you might find it intresting and it will help you express yourself easier.

I’d like to also mention that the ancient greeks thought the earth was a perfect sphere, also the ancient chinese knew the earth was spherical somehow.
This was over 2000 years ago.

But my real reason for posting is that I got a question to ask to all Christians regarding evolution and their religion.
actually its not so much a question, more of a request to look over my reasoning.

I’ve got this flow of logic, I’d like to see if you accept it.

  1. The current scientific view of evolution is more or less correct.
  2. Therefore, Adam and Eve were not the first humans created by god and quite possibly they didnt exist.
  3. Therefore, is no original sin for everyone to inherit.
  4. Jesus died for our sins, he cleared up original sin for those who accept him.
  5. If original sin does not exist, Jesus died for nothing.
  6. Therefore Christianity is all wrong.

Read full topic

OK, some people over 2000 (!) years ago thought the earth was flat - they didn’t have much else to go on, we’ve progressed past that now. Why then, have we not seen evidence to support the hypothesis of God?

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:10, topic:288595”]Moparisthebest, nothing personal but you are quite ignorant. First god created everything. After studies done by scientists that prove the big bang, you say god put the big bang into motion. First you say god created humans as they are today. After Darwin finds out evolution you say that god triggered the evolution. Gods territory is decreasing rapidly this way.

(With you I mean Christians in general)[/quote]

Now you are the one generalizing. I don’t care what other people may have said in the past before certain things were discovered, the same thing can be said about science, scientists ages ago were all positive that the earth was flat and that the universe rotated around it, until something different was discovered.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution Or Creation?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

I’ve never heard a Christian explaining how their god was created.

That would be because God wasn’t created, he has always existed and always will. (for an explanation of how this is ‘scientifically’ possible, or to debate this further, view my ‘God, from a programmers point of view’ thread so as not to derail this one)

The creator of this thread is one of the few who seems to have the same idea about this that I have. People generally think that the big bang theory and evolution contradict the existence of a greater power, when there is no reason for this. Nothing says that God couldn’t have put into motion the Big Bang (something did, and scientists don’t know what it was) and also made the rules for evolution and put them into motion.

Read full topic
